description: The royal palace of Fish-Man Island, home to King Neptune and the Ryugu Kingdom. The palace serves as the seat of government for Fish-Man Island and is located within a large air bubble.

keyEvents.title: Zoro vs Hody Jones Battle at Ryugu Palace
keyEvents.description: Zoro engages in an underwater battle with Hody Jones at Ryugu Palace while trying to protect the others and allow them to escape.
keyEvents.significance: The palace becomes a battleground between the Straw Hats and the New Fish-Man Pirates, marking a major confrontation in the arc.

keyEvents.title: Hody Floods Ryugu Palace
keyEvents.description: Hody Jones uses his Soshark technique to break the palace walls and flood Ryugu Palace, creating a dire situation for everyone who cannot breathe underwater.
keyEvents.significance: The flooding of the palace represents a critical escalation in Hody's attack and changes the battlefield to favor the Fish-Men.

statusHistory.reason: Palace walls broken and flooded by Hody Jones during his attack

description: A mysterious underwater forest on Fish-Man Island that serves as a graveyard for ships. It contains ancient Poneglyphs and is considered a sacred place with deep historical significance, particularly related to Joy Boy and the Void Century.

keyEvents.title: Robin Arrives at the Sea Forest
keyEvents.description: Robin ventures into the Sea Forest in search of ancient secrets and historical knowledge, arriving where the Thousand Sunny is docked.
keyEvents.significance: Sets up Robin's discovery of the Joy Boy Poneglyph, which is crucial to understanding the Void Century and the history of Fish-Man Island.

keyEvents.title: Robin Searches for the Poneglyph
keyEvents.description: Robin explores the Sea Forest on the path to discovering the Poneglyph that contains Joy Boy's apology to the people of Fish-Man Island.
keyEvents.significance: This location holds one of the most important Poneglyphs discovered in the series, providing insight into Joy Boy, the Ancient Weapon Poseidon, and the promise made during the Void Century.

statusHistory.reason: Ancient forest remains as a historical site

description: An underwater island located 10,000 meters below sea level beneath the Red Line. It is the homeland of Fish-Men and Merfolk, serving as a gateway between the first half of the Grand Line and the New World. The island is protected by a massive double-layered bubble.

keyEvents.title: Citizens Brand Luffy as Kidnapper
keyEvents.description: The citizens of Fish-Man Island spot Luffy with Princess Shirahoshi and brand him as a royal kidnapper, creating tension and conflict.
keyEvents.significance: Demonstrates the protective nature of Fish-Men toward Shirahoshi and their general distrust of humans, a central theme of the arc.

statusHistory.reason: The island continues to function despite internal conflicts
